meanings.definition: relating to or characteristic of an orchestra
meanings.sent1: The orchestral music filled the concert hall with beautiful sounds.
meanings.sent2: The orchestra played an orchestral piece composed by Beethoven.
meanings.sent3: The mice in the cartoon danced to the orchestral music, adding humor to the scene.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like an orchestral symphony, echoing through the room.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted the sky in an orchestral array of colors, mesmerizing everyone.

meanings.definition: of, for, or performed by an orchestra
meanings.sent1: The conductor led the orchestral performance with great enthusiasm.
meanings.sent2: The orchestral musicians practiced diligently for the upcoming concert.
meanings.sent3: The penguins put on an orchestral show for the other animals in the zoo, causing laughter all around.
meanings.sent4: The raindrops on the roof created an orchestral rhythm, soothing her to sleep.
meanings.sent5: The grand ballroom was filled with the orchestral melodies, creating a magical atmosphere.
